pkgmetadata.longdescription: Modelling Infectious Disease Superspreading from Contact Tracing Data // Analytical tools to characterize infectious disease superspreading from contact tracing surveillance data, using theoretical frameworks of branching process with transmission heterogeneity (Lloyd-Smith et al. (2005) doi:10.1038/nature04153), case size distribution (Nishiura et al. (2012) doi:10.1016/j.jtbi.2011.10.039, and Kucharski and Althaus (2015) doi:10.2807/1560-7917.ES2015.20.25.21167), and decomposition of reproduction number (Zhao et al. (2022) doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1010281).
